[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Error: expect at line 117-119] [Genesis storage failure] If GENESIS_WAYPOINT is missing from storage, the node panics during initialization - can attackers corrupt storage to prevent validator startup and cause liveness failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Config: Initialization order] [Race condition] If BaseConfig is initialized concurrently by multiple threads during node startup, can race conditions in waypoint reading cause inconsistent config state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Config: Startup validation] [Incomplete checks] Are all BaseConfig fields validated during startup, or can invalid data_dir/working_dir paths cause crashes only after the node has partially initialized? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Config: Hot reload] [State inconsistency] If BaseConfig can be reloaded without full node restart, can attackers exploit state inconsistencies between old and new configs to cause consensus issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Concurrency: Shared state] [Data race] BaseConfig derives Clone - if cloned configs are modified concurrently, can data races cause inconsistent role, waypoint, or path values across threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Concurrency: File access] [TOCTOU across threads] If multiple threads call waypoint() concurrently on FromFile variant, can TOCTOU vulnerabilities between exists() check and read cause race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Concurrency: Storage access] [Lock contention] When accessing SecureBackend storage for waypoints, is proper locking implemented, or can concurrent access cause corrupted reads/writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Integration: NodeConfig coupling] [Validation bypass] The sanitize() function takes &NodeConfig - can attackers craft NodeConfig where base validation passes but other config sections create inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Integration: NodeType parameter] [Type mismatch] The sanitize() function receives NodeType parameter but doesn't validate against BaseConfig.role - can Validator role run on NodeType::FullNode causing privilege confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Integration: ChainId parameter] [Chain confusion] The sanitize() function receives Optional ChainId but doesn't validate waypoint against it - can waypoints from different chains (mainnet, testnet) be used interchangeably causing chain confusion? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Filesystem: exists() check] [Symbolic link time-of-check] At line 78, waypoint_path.exists() is checked - can attackers exploit the gap between this check and file read to swap files or create symlinks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Filesystem: read_to_string] [Encoding attacks] The fs::read_to_string() at line 84 assumes UTF-8 encoding - can non-UTF-8 waypoint files cause panics or bypass validation through encoding exploits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Filesystem: File permissions] [Unauthorized read] When reading waypoint files, are file permissions checked to ensure only the node user can read them, or can other processes read sensitive waypoint data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Filesystem: Directory traversal] [Parent access] Can data_dir or waypoint file paths access parent directories through '..' sequences, potentially reading files outside intended directories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Crypto: Storage backend encryption] [Plaintext storage] Are waypoints stored in SecureBackend encrypted at rest, or can attackers with storage access read waypoints in plaintext and plan fork attacks? (High)
